result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberlee M Puls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing December 1, 2014 or penalty 5 days Huber for non-payment.

Straight time.  Sentence credit for 134 days.
Court DEEMS time served.
DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to provide sample within 7 DAYS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberlee M Puls

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 4 and 5 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 134 days jail.  Credit for 134 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing December 1, 2014; alternate 5 days Huber
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid through payment plan for court costs; alternate 5 days Huber
- DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to provide sample within 7 days.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting some of the discovery and requests short adjournment.  Defense moves to modify bail.  Court denies defendant's motion to modify bail at this time.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kimberlee M Puls
Current: 1400 Northview Rd., c/o Waukesha County Huber Facility, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-03-2014)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective T. Lusmann from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.   Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

COURT GRANTS HUBER BAILEE STATUS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN AS SET AS FOLLOWS:
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program to include drug screens.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Defendant to have no contact with alleged co defendants victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court hears defense bail motion. Attorney Bugenhagen presents bail argument to the court. State objects to modification of bail and presents their argument to the court. Court denies motion to modify the amount of cash bail, but grants huber bailee status to the defendant. Preliminary hearing remains as set.
Preliminary hearing on July 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kimberlee M Puls in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days.  Bail to be addressed on 6/27/2014.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
